title: Democrat Spanberger wins race for Virginia governor
description: US media project the former congresswoman and CIA officer beat Republican Earle-Sears to become state's first woman governor.
content:
Democrat Abigail Spanberger has been projected as winning the race for Virginia governor after a closely-watched election which her party hoped could signal a national trend.
The former congresswoman and CIA officer defeated the state's Republican Li... [2247 chars]

title: Human error may have led to grooming gang cases being dropped, says NCA
description: Officers say there appear to be cases where lines of inquiry were not pursued properly.
content:
Human error could have led to criminal cases involving alleged grooming gangs being dropped, the early stages of a massive review has found.
Operation Beaconport - a National Crime Agency project tasked with unearthing failings to tackle grooming gan... [4675 chars]

title: Tesla says Musk should be paid $1tn - will shareholders agree?
description: The car-maker is lobbying fiercely for the pay package, which is being voted on ahead of its AGM on Thursday.
content:
Ahead of Tesla's annual general meeting (AGM) on Thursday there's been one key message the electric car-maker has been hammering home to shareholders: the boss is worth $1tn.
It has taken out digital ads to make the case for Elon Musk's proposed bump... [6949 chars]

title: Cargo plane carrying large amount of fuel crashes in Kentucky, with several reported injured and fires still burning
description: Three people were on board the UPS aircraft, which was bound for Hawaii when it crashed near Louisville airport.
content:
Cargo plane crashes shortly after takeoff from Louisville airport
Peter Bowes
North America correspondent
If you're just joining us, a cargo plane has crashed in the US state of Kentucky, shortly after departing from Louisville International Airport.... [3044 chars]

title: Nearly all drivers say vehicles' lights are too bright in study
description: The study, commissioned by the Department for Transport, was completed by Berkshire's TRL.
content:
Nearly all UK drivers said they thought headlights were too bright and that they have been dazzled by oncoming vehicles, according to a major study.
The government said last week that it will take a closer look at the design of cars and headlamps aft... [1069 chars]
